channel.title: Index on Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society
channel.description: Recent content in Index on Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society

item.title: Contact Us
item.author: officers@cardiffars.org.uk (Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society)
item.description: We are a little busy exploring space right now; we’ll get back to you when we return to this solar system.

item.title: Es'hail 2 Satellite
item.author: officers@cardiffars.org.uk (Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society)
item.description: Es’hail 2 is a communications satellite recently launched by the Qatar Satellite Company which carries an Amateur Radio transponder capable of both narrowband and wideband modes.

item.title: Radio Direction Finding
item.author: officers@cardiffars.org.uk (Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society)
item.description: Direction Finding (DF) is an international competative sport where a team or individual has to locate a number of hidden transmitters using basic equipment, namely: a receiver, directional antenna and (usually) a map.

item.title: 401 Unauthorized
item.author: officers@cardiffars.org.uk (Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society)
item.description: A user name and password is required. You’ve attempted to visit a section of the website reserved for authorized users.

item.title: Cardiff Microwave Roundtable
item.author: officers@cardiffars.org.uk (Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society)
item.description: About Program Dinner Register Dinner There will be a group dinner in the evening from 18:30 to 21:00 at a nearby restaurant within easy walking distance of the main venue.

item.title: Cardiff Microwave Roundtable
item.author: officers@cardiffars.org.uk (Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society)
item.description: About Program Dinner Register CUARS will be hosting a meeting of the UK Microwave Group on Saturday March 16, 2019 at our campus in Cardiff.

item.title: Cardiff Microwave Roundtable
item.author: officers@cardiffars.org.uk (Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society)
item.description: About Program Dinner Register March 16, 2019 Time Event Description 10:30 Welcome 10:40 Talk 1 11:30 Talk 2 12:10 Break Measurements, project demos, etc 12:30 Lunch Buffet at the University 13:30 Talk 3 14:10 Talk 4 14:50 Break 15:15 Talk 5 15:55 Talk 6 16:35 Break 16:50 Talk 7 17:30 Closing remarks 18:30 - 21:00 Dinner

item.title: Cardiff Microwave Roundtable
item.author: officers@cardiffars.org.uk (Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society)
item.description: About Program Dinner Register Registration We request that you pre-register so we can accurately judge the amount of food and beverages to have on hand and so we can reserve enough space at dinner.

item.title: Equipment
item.author: officers@cardiffars.org.uk (Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society)
item.description: Cardiff ARS is fortunate to have had a Software Defined Radio transceiver donated to the society. We use it with GNU Radio to demonstrate RF and communication signal concepts during our info sessions and to run demonstrations at public events.

item.title: Getting Licensed
item.author: officers@cardiffars.org.uk (Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society)
item.description: Anyone is allowed to receive and listen to signals being broadcast, but as described in the What is Amateur Radio page it is necessary to get a license before transmitting.

item.title: Join the Society
item.author: officers@cardiffars.org.uk (Cardiff University Amateur Radio Society)
item.description: We are in the process of affiliating ourselves with the Cardiff University Student’s Union but until that process is complete you can express your interest and have us send you some more information by joining us using this Google Form.
